text:
- Takeda is a global
biopharmaceutical company.
We're focused on helping the scientists,
so the innovators and builders at Takeda

come up with the life-saving
treatments of the future.

We had grown many times
through acquisition.
So we had this weight of the past.

Spending all of our
time and energy, really,
on that technical debt or remediation,
maintenance, just keeping things running.
There was a massive opportunity in front

of us migrating most of those
applications to the cloud.

We chose to build on AWS because
it had the greatest number
of services available in the catalog.
But more than that, the spirit,

the way product teams work
at AWS is very similar
to what we want at Takeda.
We have over 700 applications,
7,000 instances that are running.

We have closed nine or 10
of our 13 data centers.

We run an enterprise
data backbone now on AWS.

And the impact of putting
all of this data in one place
and having it accessible has been huge.
We had something like six months

to nine months to get
anything out the door.
Now we can do things in less than 30 days.
We have greater reliability
than we had even in our own data centers.

We get access to not only
the latest technologies,
but we get access to a company
who does the heavy lifting for us.

And that frees up our energy
to focus on what really matters

which is to innovate in life
sciences and to save patients.
(upbeat music)
